snippet: Public announcements offered assurances of safety for civilians and edicts against looting and executions in the city. But witnesses say almost the exact opposite is actually happening.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting.

abstract: Residents of Kunduz, Afghanistan, report Taliban is committing atrocities, including executions, burnings and lootings, despite explicit, publicized assurances from Taliban leaders they would practice a more tolerant style of governing than in Taliban's past.
lead_paragraph: Public announcements offered assurances of safety for civilians and edicts against looting and executions in the city. But witnesses say almost the exact opposite is actually happening.

headline.print_headline: Taking Hold in a Captured City, the New Taliban Echo the Old
headline.main: Taking Hold in Kunduz, Afghanistan, New Taliban Echoed the Old
